title: hopenotlate
author: hopenotlate
content: First of all, I apologize for being late (reading my nickname it seems rather ironic) but some real life problems kept me away from the PC and made me miss my account creationÂ  tenth anniversary.Even though I am not a person who loves being the center of attention or showing off, I think this is an achievement that should be honored, that I'm proud off ( I never gave up my faith in crypto) and above all a tribute of gratitude to this place to which I owe practically all my, albeit limited, knowledge of crypto environment.I enjoyed all the 136 days, 20 hours ad 37 minutes I stayed logged inÂ   ad above all I never experencied a boring day in crypto.Thank you all for making this place my online safe haven. On a side note , just out of curiosity, I digged back to my first post here and rereading itQuote from: hopenotlate on December 03, 2013, 10:06:35 AMHi all,my nickname says all.I first heard about bitcoin during 2011 but didn't understand it, folded and moved on.Last days I read about their value near to $1000 and it ruined my days because I was near to get this train but didn't.Now I would like to enter and hope someone can address me to the first steps to do.First of all, I guess, I need to make a wallet, right? Where/how can I do this?Do I need a wallet for every cryptocurrency I would like to hold?Thx in advance for your patience and cooperationit definitely seems I wasn't too late.Â   I love this place!

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Congratulations @hopenotlate reaching your remarkable 10-year milestone in the Bitcointalk forum. Your commitment to the crypto community are truly honorable. 10 years is long period and possibly you may faced different challenges in your life but due to your true faith in crypto and the valuable knowledge you remains here and hasn't give up . Your time spend here are appreciated . Your continued activity has positive positive impact on this forum. We wish you remain amongst us for many years of engaging discussions, shared knowledge of crypto .Thank you for being an essential part of our community.

comments.author: hg_away
comments.body: Congratulations @hopenotlate 10 years is not a small period and that you were able to continue to survive is something unique. I think that when you registered here the price was around $300 and now it is $44,000.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Yes, congratulations from me too. I hope you have taken advantage of having known this forum so soon and you are much better off now financially than if you had not known it, which does not always happen. Although from what you say I get the impression that it does. How do you see the next 10 years in this forum and bitcoin?

comments.author: encryptogon
comments.body: Congratulations @hopenotlate on your 10 years long journey with Bitcoin. You have seen it all; the Ups and Downs of BTC. Wishing you many more years of activity on this forum. I have just started my journey with Bitcoin and this forum, wish me luck Bro.

comments.author: BABY SHOES
comments.body: The day many users reached 10 years of being on the bitcointalk forum, it's a great appreciation for sticking around and congratulations to @hopenotlate on the 10th anniversary which has now reached a milestone and will continue to stay here.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Congratulations on your milestone achievements, it's not about being a member of this community that matters alone but the level of what we have contributed to it's growth, we are liable to have faced alot of challenges at the course of our stay, but they make us get stronger to stay more by taking up the challenge, alot of people were nowhere to be found and you all started together, i think you're one of the privileged ones to enjoy the benefits of this forum through your activeness, keep it on.

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: There are a few privileged ones, who not only succeeded in thriving in this forum, they did made a name of themselves. To be able to get recognise everyone is very hard for me. I might have missed you or I might have ignored you as I was not able to catch your username to the best of my abilities.That doesn't matter and this is the time to celebrate you and your achievement. A 10 years have passed by and I think another 10 years will add up in just no time. I pray for your health and I pray that you keep on celebrating your achievements in the same manner like you did for your 10 years existence in this forum.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Congrats on making 10 years, I bet there were very few that thought the forum would even be around 10 years. We all love this place

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: This is really amazing. Not every day you come across members who signed up early when it all started or few years after and still sticking around till date. In other words, 10 years is not 10 days, so I'm going to raise a glass of champagne to you for this milestone achievement. I hope you continue to age like a fine wine and get to leave your mark on the forum. Keep riding on and a very big congratulations to you Hopenotlate!

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: Congratulations buddy 10 years have passed in this memorable forum.This online place is best for exchanging thoughts about bitcoin, here we can see the development that is so fast through so I hope it will stay together here.Well I love this place, every day we continue to be here.Halving soon, hold on tight buddy.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: Congratulations @hopenotlate, 10years on the forum is a milestone worth celebrating. Iâ€™m not so familiar with the username, Iâ€™m sure those in the Italian local board need no introduction to your works. The consistency is admirable, the time we spend here and the relationships we build with others make it easy to get attached to the forum and very hard to leave. Cheers to another 10years of Bitcointalk!

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Congrats on your 10th birthday hopenotlate!It's funny that yesterday it was was my 6th birthday in Bitcointalk forum, so I guess I have to prepare for next year when I am going to school. Time flies so fast, but this was/is one heck of a ride for sure.

comments.author: BITCOIN4X
comments.body: Happy 10 years to you @hopenotlate. 10 years is a milestone worth celebrating, especially since you are an active user who posts regularly. Not sure how many users who registered their accounts in 2013 still post regularly today, but my guess is there aren't many of them anymore. Many users have left for any reasons, in fact we never know how many users have left the forum due to Covid or previous difficult times. I hope you will stay longer and enjoy it. I am also happy to be here, who will turn 6 in March next year.Quote from: hg_away on December 11, 2023, 03:40:57 PMCongratulations @hopenotlate 10 years is not a small period and that you were able to continue to survive is something unique. I think that when you registered here the price was around $300 and now it is $44,000.Now the price is no longer at $44,000, but at $40k.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: Congratulations with reaching 10 years milestone! It's long journey. Back then when you joined Bitcointalk, probably you didn't expected that you will spend so much time here. You're old time member, but I'm a bit surprised that I don't remember your name and probably I haven't interacted with you before. It's probably because you spend most of time on Italian and Collectibles boards.And your first post looks good, especially considering that it was 2013 when there weren't so much information for beginners.

comments.author: JollyGood
comments.body: Quote from: hopenotlate on December 11, 2023, 03:19:45 PMI love this place!Congratulations on your 10th anniversary. What a milestone Quote from: yahoo62278 on December 11, 2023, 05:51:23 PMCongrats on making 10 years, I bet there were very few that thought the forum would even be around 10 years. We all love this place The way you are making that statement invites me to ask you a question because you will be celebrating your 10 year anniversary in around 7 months time: When it was 2014, what did you think would happen to Bitcoin, crypto and to this forum in 10 years time?

comments.author: avp2306
comments.body: Another milestone for reaching reaching 10 years of existence in this beautiful forum and not everyone could ever last for this long.Again congratulations since your presence for long years is already a good contribution for this forum. Looking forward for more people to last for a decade or even more.

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.created_time: December 12, 2023, 07:32:09 AMLast edit: December 12, 2023, 07:42:33 AM by Mia Chloe
comments.body: A big congratulations hopenotlatethis this is definitely a good motivation for newbies to never give up but keep trying their best to make quality contributions to the forum. From your forum registration date it seems you have always been a supporter of Bitcoin.Congrats once again as you seldom find members who are still active that long.Quotemy nickname says allHaha your nickname ain't that crazy ðŸ˜… I've seen crazierHappy holidays ðŸ™‚

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Quote from: JollyGood on December 11, 2023, 09:14:35 PMQuote from: hopenotlate on December 11, 2023, 03:19:45 PMI love this place!Congratulations on your 10th anniversary. What a milestone Quote from: yahoo62278 on December 11, 2023, 05:51:23 PMCongrats on making 10 years, I bet there were very few that thought the forum would even be around 10 years. We all love this place The way you are making that statement invites me to ask you a question because you will be celebrating your 10 year anniversary in around 7 months time: When it was 2014, what did you think would happen to Bitcoin, crypto and to this forum in 10 years time?I had no expectations of bitcoin when I first came the the forum. I played alot of poker on what was then called seals with clubs now known just as SwC. I heard about the forum and how bitcoin was more than something we could gamble with on poker, so I made an account. Bitcoin then started to change my life.Now, I feel like bitcoin is here to stay. The future as we have heard it called over the years.

comments.author: ineedhelpplease
comments.body: 10 years is a long time at Bitcointalk. Congratulations on this milestone!
